data.title: Cannot move lines when find widget is open
data.body: Windows, `alt+up` and `alt+down` no longer move lines if find widget is open

data.title: A few suggestions to make this the best code editor ever!
data.body:
A few suggestions that will make this the best code editor out there. I mainly use it for PHP. I would love to have a line go vertically from opening and closing elements like in notepad++. Example.
{ } It would be nice if you made CTRL-D to duplicate lines like in notepad++. Then your Code editor would be all I hope for. Also one last thing, When you have a lot of tabs open make the horizontal (left to right) scrolling bar bigger (it is 3 pixels tall and would be nice if it was 6 pixels - it only shows up when you hover over it anyways). Then we don' have to strain our eyes to move it. Thanks! I love this editor the most!

data.title: Run python in terminal with path having spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a folder with spaces in its name, and create a simple python file
2. ctrl+shift+p to run the file in VSCode, it will pop up an error which related to the path of the folder. which should have quotes on that path. 

``` bash
> python c:\test - test\test.py
# error
can't find '__main__' module  in 'c:\test'
```

data.title: Code Helper high CPU usage on MacBook Pro 15
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.2 - OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.6 I've notice there are several closed posts related to this issue, but it started to act up again. Before 1.5.2 I was using 1.3 since 1.4 had a problem with syntax highlighting and from time to time I used to get high cpu from "electron helper" even tough I have git disabled and only 3 extensions : "Project Manager", "Run on Save" and "HTML CSS Support". I upgrade to 1.5 and now Code Helper is the one that does it. I can happen 2, 3 times per day. It doesn't matter if you have lots of files opened or not, or if you are doing some had work, it just happens randomly. Once I left it minimize more then half an hour and my fans just started up suddenly as a result of the Code Helper going up to 99.9 CPU usage. I've attached a screenshot showing the usage :

data.title: getPathLabel(): Cannot read property '1' of null
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install a fresh vs code from https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/?dv=win, with no extension installed
2. Follow the extension tutorial until the first F5: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensions/example-hello-world
3. The new vscode instance is launching with the extension but we get an error :

`/C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:115 Cannot read property '1' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null
    at Object.s [as getPathLabel] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:29:17760)
    at t.getDescription (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:85:7799)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:103:21871
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at t.getUniqueTabLabels (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:103:21710)
    at t.doUpdate (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:103:20917)
    at t.doRefresh (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:103:22330)
    at t.e.onSchedule (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:100:22145)
    at t.e.refresh (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:100:22443)
    at e.createTitleControl (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:104:12264)`

I unintalled/installed vscode. I tried with insider build too, always the same error.

data.title: Adjust cursor position on new line or don't emit empty spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (67a46126c83aac8c715d4c318fcfd18a183658bf, 2016-09-13T11:09:28.863Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:

TypeScript code 

``` ts
class Test {

    test() {

    }
}
```
1. Put cursor on line `2:0`
2. Hit enter

Initial:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18477365/717dd642-799b-11e6-847b-0c1ca9a39288.png)

User presses Enter:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18477384/7eb03a1c-799b-11e6-97a4-186930cd7571.png)

Notice how cursor is at `3:0` but there are spaces in front of cursor
Natural thing is to use tab to get to proper indent location which will leave empty spaces in front:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/18477416/9f91e5fa-799b-11e6-9b6b-297055261097.png)

(Users might not be aware there are extra whitespaces if they dont have `renderWhitespace`)

So seems like it should put cursor at the end of that whitespaces or not append whitespaces

FYI - Both Atom and Sublime - do not append whitespaces

data.title: Make a pass over all places where we show paths and use white-space: pre
data.body:
![sep-13-2016 16-18-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/18477413/e5ead458-79cd-11e6-9979-0dac2203d965.gif)
This is a totally dumb case but I encountered it while testing something in Node with spaces in paths and it feels worth fixing to me.

If you edit leading or trailing whitespace in the file explorer, the change isn't saved. If you add some outside of vscode, it won't be displayed in the tree. If there are multiple spaces between letters, it's collapsed to look like one. And, if you edit the file name in some other way, then all leading/trailing spaces are removed.

data.title: Format nested arrays
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

In php (and I would assume javascript as well), I am defining an array which has a nested array.

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Enter this code:

$temp = array(
'label1' => 'this is a test'
,'label2' => array(
'inner1' => 'test1'
,'inner2' => 'test2'
,'inner3' => 'test3'
,'inner4' => 'test4'
)
,'label3' => 'another test'
);
1. press Shift+Alt+F

The arrays are not formatted as I would expect. Should look something like:

$temp = array(
    'label1' => 'this is a test'
    ,'label2' => array(
        'inner1' => 'test1'
        ,'inner2' => 'test2'
        ,'inner3' => 'test3'
        ,'inner4' => 'test4'
    )
    ,'label3' => 'another test'
);

[test.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/469914/test.zip)

data.title: 'KeyboardEvent.keyIdentifier' is deprecated and will be removed in M54
data.body:
Running with Chrome 52 I see this in the console. 'KeyboardEvent.keyIdentifier' is deprecated and will be removed in M54, around September 2016. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/5316065118650368 for more details.

Seems to be used in `nativeKeymap.ts`

data.title: Bad syntax highlighting when using template strings in TypeScript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

The following code 

``` typescript
// (ironically, GitHub has the same issue as can be seen below)
let a = `a b ${(new Date).getFullYear()} c`
let b = 0;
```

... breaks syntax highlighting for TypeScript:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/734593/18473540/d704742c-79bd-11e6-86ac-a978791e2576.png)

The problem appears as soon as the function call to `getFullYear()` has parentheses. Removing the parentheses partially "fixes" the problem:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/734593/18473571/f0aca188-79bd-11e6-9977-24b1ce11e789.png)

data.title: Support text editing keybindings customization for quick open input

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: maxOS 10.11.6 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. define a key binding, such as 

``` json
    { "key": "ctrl+w",               "command": "deleteWordLeft" },
```
1. open command palette 
2. type some text
3. attempt to use defined key binding on text entered into command palette

Looking at the docs, I can't find a `when` clause that would cause keybindings to apply there. I mostly want `ctrl+n`\+ `ctrl+p` for up/down + `ctrl+w` for delete-word.

All three work great in the editor, but are ignored in the command palette.

Thanks!

data.title: TypeScript file indexer is not exposed to extension developers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In order to implement auto-import by symbol name in TypeScript one needs to have a file indexer available, or some way to get the filenames and paths of the given symbol.

There is a great extension for TypeScript by @buehler called [TypeScript Hero](https://github.com/buehler/typescript-hero/) but it needs to re-implement file indexer just to get auto-import working reliably, obviously this is hard task and should not be done lightly. [I opened an issue to his extension, and he mentioned this.](https://github.com/buehler/typescript-hero/issues/42)

Problem is easily illustrated by this screenshot: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/64731/18434892/a696e948-78f8-11e6-9e36-451393c04039.png)

Apparently there is no way to get the filepath as underlined in above screenshot at the extension level.

data.title: Allow debug adapter to list dynamic scripts in the file explorer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be interesting if a debug adapter could send a list of files that can't be resolved to source files on disk - either because they are not associated with a file on disk (eval scripts) or can't be, because of sourcemap or other config issues, etc. This would allow the user to browse and set breakpoints in these scripts, which current you can only do if you use a `debugger` statement or manage to step into it from another script. It would also allow more transparency with config issues - if a breakpoint fails to bind in `app.ts`, but an `app.ts` with the wrong path shows up in the dynamic scripts section, then that would give you a better hint on how to fix your config. Currently you can only guess or dig through log files from the debug adapter.

The modules UI would be a good place to prototype this once that's supported. Then if it makes sense, we could try it in the file explorer.

data.title: Tab click automatically changes tree view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OS X

Hi, this is a function present in vscode since the top tabs are available, but for me it is an issue because I don't want it to act like that. I'm sure that there exists some developers who think the same, I'm not asking to remove this, but is there a way to enable and disable this option? If not, would be great to have one.

Thanks,
have a nice day.

data.title: Have to press enter twice after typing out full completion
data.body:
If I have a variable, say `set`, and type `set` in the debug console, then the completions popup is visible with `set` and any other completions. Then the user has to press enter twice - once to close the completions popup, and again to eval `set`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/18468282/8a05fa5c-79a3-11e6-8654-89b8aad2555a.png)

I think that if the user has typed the full name of the completion, then pressing enter once should close the popup and eval that value. But if the user only types part of the completion like `se`, it should work as it does now.

data.title: Make Updating Extensions Easier
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:05:12.065Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

At present, whenever I get an update to an extension I have to click "update" for each one, and then "enable" for each. Each time I enable an extension I'm prompted to restart VS Code.

In general, I just want to update and re-enable all of the extensions that have updates. A single "update and enable all" option would be really helpful. Even if this were to only be possible on already installed/enabled extensions, this would save a lot of time.

data.title: Intellisense doesn't work on JavaScript file until I change language mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create folder `Hello`
2. In `Hello`, create file `app.js`
3. `code .` or open this folder in VSCode
4. In app.js, type : `console.` - No Intellisense
5. Change the language mode to "JavaScript React"
6. Type `console.` - Intellisense is present

Gif to show what happen : 

![ezgif-340640585](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/796803/18466732/1b3e3158-799d-11e6-9258-b714fa50cbd3.gif)

No Extension, brand new VSCode
